title: Keep Your Pet Warm Indoors
shortDescription: Provide cozy blankets and a warm sleeping area during winter.
details: Ensure your pet has a soft, warm, and dry resting place away from cold floors and drafts.

title: Protect Paws from Cold Surfaces
shortDescription: Use paw balms or winter boots to prevent dryness and cracks.
details: Snow and ice can damage paws. Clean and moisturize their paws after every walk.

title: Provide Proper Winter Nutrition
shortDescription: Increase nutrients to maintain energy and body heat.
details: Pets burn more energy in winter. A balanced diet helps them stay warm and healthy.

title: Limit Outdoor Time in Extreme Cold
shortDescription: Avoid long exposure to freezing temperatures.
details: Short walks are fine, but always monitor pets for shivering or discomfort.

title: Groom Your Pet Regularly
shortDescription: Keep fur clean and untangled for better insulation.
details: Brushing helps distribute natural oils and keeps their coat effective against cold.

title: Hydrate Your Pet
shortDescription: Ensure fresh water is always available.
details: Cold weather can dehydrate pets. Warm water can encourage drinking if needed.

title: Use Heated Beds or Blankets
shortDescription: Provide gentle warmth especially for elderly pets.
details: Monitor the temperature to avoid overheating, and ensure cords are pet-safe.

title: Watch for Winter Illnesses
shortDescription: Keep an eye on sneezing, coughing, or lethargy.
details: Early detection of cold-related illnesses ensures proper care and veterinary support.
